name: Leng Saeb Recipe (Spicy Thai Pork Bone Soup)
description: This recipe for leng saeb makes a spicy Thai pork bone soup loaded with chilies and fresh herbs.
recipeIngredient: 42 ounces pork bones (neck or back bones)

itemListElement.text: Crush garlic, coriander root, and black peppercorns with a mortar and pestle.
itemListElement.name: Crush garlic, coriander root, and black peppercorns with a mortar and pestle.

itemListElement.text: Place a large pot filled with water on medium heat. Add the pounded mixture to the water.
itemListElement.name: Place a large pot filled with water on medium heat. Add the pounded mixture to the water.

itemListElement.text: Once the water reaches a boil, carefully add the pork bones to the pot.
itemListElement.name: Once the water reaches a boil, carefully add the pork bones to the pot.

itemListElement.text: Include sliced onion, light soy sauce, and salt.
itemListElement.name: Include sliced onion, light soy sauce, and salt.

itemListElement.text: When the broth comes to a boil again, remove any scum that floats to the surface. Let the stock simmer for about an hour, or until the meat on the bones is tender.
itemListElement.name: When the broth comes to a boil again, remove any scum that floats to the surface. Let the stock simmer for about an hour, or until the meat on the bones is tender.

itemListElement.text: Pour 17 fl oz of the prepared pork stock into a separate saucepan.
itemListElement.name: Pour 17 fl oz of the prepared pork stock into a separate saucepan.

itemListElement.text: Add fish sauce, freshly squeezed lime juice, chilies to taste, culantro, and green onions.
itemListElement.name: Add fish sauce, freshly squeezed lime juice, chilies to taste, culantro, and green onions.

itemListElement.text: Arrange the tender pork bones in a serving dish and ladle the prepared broth over them. Serve with a side of rice.
